section.title: Adding a certificate into an ISO image
section.para: As root, proceed with the following steps to disassemble the ISO image, and insert a new Certificate Authority or Signing Certificate into the provided image.

step.para: Download the deployment ISO image from Glance and place it in /tmp/ as ironic-deploy.iso.
Make a temporary folder to mount the ironic-deploy.iso image to in order to extract its contents.
Mount the ironic-deploy.iso image file to the folder you just created.
Make a temporary location to stage the new image.
Copy the contents from the previous image into the new temporary staging location.
Make a folder to house the ramdisk that will need to be extracted from the ISO image.
Append your CA certificate to the file located at /tmp/new_deploy_ramdisk/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/requests/cacert.pem, example below:
Replace the pre-existing initial ramdisk in the extracted disk image.
Change directory back to the new deployment ISO image folder.
Ensure that the program xorriso is available, you may need to execute apt-get install xorriso to install it.
Create the new ISO deployment image with the following command.
step.screen: xorriso -as mkisofs -b isolinux/isolinux.bin -c boot.cat \ -V VMEDIA_BOOT_ISO -r -J -no-emul-boot -boot-load-size 4 \ -boot-info-table -eltorito-alt-boot --efi-boot boot/grub/efi.img \ -isohybrid-gpt-basdat -isohybrid-apm-hfsplus -o /tmp/new_ironic_deploy.iso ./

section.para: Once completed, the new image can be found at /tmp/new_ironic_deploy.iso, and will need to be uploaded to Glance. New Glance IDs will need to be recorded for any instances requiring this new image, as noted in the parent paragraph
